sentences.en: A sceptre is one of the attributes of a king.
sentences.cn: 权杖是帝王的象征之一。

sentences.en: And he came down holding his crown with one hand and his sceptre with the other.
sentences.cn: 国王一手拿着王冠,一手执着王节,走下塔来.

sentences.en: He is often associated with a sceptre, cornucopia , or Cerburus, the three - headed dog.
sentences.cn: 他常与节杖, 丰饶之角, 三个头的地狱看门狗有关.

sentences.en: Our flag sceptre all who meet obey.
sentences.cn: 我们的旗帜就是王笏,谁碰到都得服从.

sentences.en: Seven who hold the sceptre shall perish, one of them being canonised.
sentences.cn: 七个持有节杖的会毁灭, 他们中的其中一位会被封为圣人.

sentences.en: The crown is yours in majesty and the sceptre is yours in glory.
sentences.cn: 庄严的王冠是属于你的,光荣的王节是属于你的.

sentences.en: The sceptre is an attribute of kingly power.
sentences.cn: 节杖是国王权力的象徵.

sentences.en: Therefore, let me go, for I must wander again over the world, and may not tarry here, though ye bring me the crown and the sceptre.
sentences.cn: 所以，让我走吧，我必须再次到处去寻找我的妈妈，我不能在这耽搁，尽管你们给我王冠和权杖。

words.tran_cn: 授予…王权；拥登王位（等于sceptre）

trans.tran_cn: （尤指象征君主权位的）权杖，王权，君权
trans.tran_en: a decorated stick carried by kings or queens at ceremonies
